channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024030285
item.description:
Report X-2024030285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-03
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came to QA wet and smelling strongly, QA put package in bag and tote to contain the spill. Inspected to find 5 gal plastic jerrican had leaked through loose top. Put package and all contents into salvage drum. DescribePack: Leaked through loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill contained in bag and tote

item.title: Report X-2024030351
item.description:
Report X-2024030351

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pail was on van line when discovered wet and leaking out, QA placed inside a lined tote and took to hazmat cage to get inspected. DescribePack: Lid came loose on pail and the liquid was leaking out. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Pail was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hamat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report X-2024030350
item.description:
Report X-2024030350

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg. went through the sorter and the loader noticed outer carton leaking and notified manager. DescribePack: Closures came loose and liquid leaked out soiling outer carton and inner cans. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Pkg. was placed inside a lined tote and was taken to hazmat cage to get inspected.

item.title: Report X-2024030196
item.description:
Report X-2024030196

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic jugs in corrugated carton. Loose caps on all jugs. Defective seal under one cap allowed leakage that damaged carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024030188
item.description:
Report X-2024030188

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was placed in a bag and container as soon as box was identified with as spill and that it was a Hazmat. It was then taken over to the Hazmat cage and placed in a secured area for further processing. DescribePack: The Package had 4 Gallons of lime way. 1 bottle had a loose cap causing the spill to the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a hazmat bag and tote to prevent any further human contact. It was taken to the proper location to be processed.

item.title: Report X-2024030184
item.description:
Report X-2024030184

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded when it was noticed that it was wet. It was placed in a lined hazmat tote and brought to the designated damaged hazmat area. DescribePack: Upon opening it was discovered that one of the bottles had a loose cap causing the liquid to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright to stop the leaking. After opening the package, the loose cap was tightened.

item.title: Report E-2024030179
item.description:
Report E-2024030179

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-13T18:16:37+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While receiving a shipment at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO, a leaking drum was identified. Further inspection revealed the drum was punctured by a nail protruding from the pallet the drum was loaded on. Less than 1/2 gallon of UN1993 Waste Flammable Liquid, n.o.s. (xylene, ethylbenzene) was released from the drum. Cleanup was conducted in-house.

item.title: Report I-2024030009
item.description:
Report I-2024030009

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: DOLORES
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T FORCE FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DRIVER WAS MOVING SKID TO LIFTGATE, THE PALLET JACK JAMMED ON DRIVER CAUSING THE DRUMS TO BECOME UNSTABLE TO WHERE THE PALLET JACK AND DRUMS FELL OFF THE TRAILER. ONE OF THE 4 DRUMS KEEP ROLLING DOWN THE HILL INTO A POND. NO LEAKAGE FROM THE 3 DRUMS LEFT ON PARKING LOT, BUT OTHER DRUM WAS NOT REACHABLE DUE TO 8FT PLUS DROP OF LEDGE INTO POND. NO MATERIAL LOSS, DRUM INTACT WHEN TEAM RECOVERED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024030113
item.description:
Report X-2024030113

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LOCATION OF SPILL IN PROPER PPE. RESPONDER CONTAINED SPILL - USING SPILL-TRAY. RESPONDER RETURNED TO THE DMP TO PROCESS PACKAGE.
